intro: Pupalia atropurpurea, commonly known as purple poppy mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features striking violet to purple petals that surround a central yellow cluster of stamens. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
